FuncDef: The reset arp interface command clears ARP entries learned by a specified interface. The reset arp interface command clears ARP entries learned by a specified interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Clears dynamic ARP entries containing a specified IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Clears dynamic ARP entries learned on a specified the name interface.
-

Clears all dynamic ARP entries learned by a specified interface.
-

ExtraInfo: If an unauthorized user sends a large number of ARP messages to a device, the device learns a large number of ARP entries in a short period of time, causing a buffer overflow. As a result, users may fail to access the network. To resolve the problem, run the reset arp command to delete invalid ARP entries so that new ARP entries can be created to allow authorized user access.
